title: Building Editor: Deleting all walls from a level mixes up levels added afterwards

content.raw:
1. Open Building Editor

2. Add some walls to the current level (`Level 1`)

3. Add a level (`Level 2`). It is created with walls cloned from the level below.

4. Delete all walls from `Level 2`

5. Add a level (`Level 3`). It is added overlapped with `Level 2` (if you go back and forth between them and add walls, you can see that the walls are added on the same height). This is confusing...

6. Delete `Level 1`. `Level 2` and `Level 3` go down together.

7. Delete `Level 2`. `Level 3` is moved below the ground - not good...
content.html:
1. Open Building Editor

  2. Add some walls to the current level (Level 1)

  3. Add a level (Level 2). It is created with walls cloned from the level below.

  4. Delete all walls from Level 2

  5. Add a level (Level 3). It is added overlapped with Level 2 (if you go back and forth between them and add walls, you can see that the walls are added on the same height). This is confusing...

  6. Delete Level 1. Level 2 and Level 3 go down together.

  7. Delete Level 2. Level 3 is moved below the ground - not good...
